page.title: 11Going Shopping
page.content: Our survey showed us that the majority of families on the Rookery Farm Estate make a big weekly shopping expedition to a nearby Hypermarket, usually towards the end of the week. They buy food, toiletries, cleaning materials and general provisions. Over half these families go shopping by car. The local shops are used once, twice or three times a week and occasionally they shop in a nearby town or city. There is a local parade of shops, that serve the Estate, at Belland Drive. Many of these shops found Monday, Tuesday and Saturday to be their busiest days. The shops comprise of a butcher, wool/haberdashery, newsagent, hairdressers, Post Office/hardware, fish and chip bar, supermarket, Estate Agent, an Electrical shop, and a Cycle shop.
